definition: random inspection/to do a spot check
to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash
to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)

sentences.english: Check the cash in foreign exchange at any time.
sentences.chinese: 隨時抽查外幣兌換的現金。

sentences.english: Sixth, the cultural market report checks 12318 Tel.
sentences.chinese: 六是抽查12318文化市場舉報電話。

sentences.english: Subway and rail passengers are subject to random bag searches.
sentences.chinese: 地鐵和輕軌乘客的誇包可能會隨時受到抽查。

sentences.english: The satisfaction rate of spot checks was 96%.
sentences.chinese: 訪視效果抽查滿意率達96%。

sentences.english: I guess she meant what she said. They're just doing a random search.
sentences.chinese: 我猜她說話算話，他們只是在做一項抽查而已。

sentences.english: Custom officer carry out spot check on incoming car.
sentences.chinese: 海關官員對入境的車輛進行抽查。

sentences.english: If you've taped the meeting, be sure to spot-check the tape.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有會議錄像，要抽查錄像帶。

sentences.english: Spot check of N. D. T. performed by supplier.
sentences.chinese: 對供應商的無損檢測過程進行抽查。

sentences.english: A spot check showed that at least five percent of the oranges were contaminated.
sentences.chinese: 一項抽查顯示那些柳橙至少有百分之五受到了污染。

sentences.english: Expenses thus incurred shall be disbursed in accordance with the relevant regulations of the State Council.
sentences.chinese: 監督抽查所需檢驗費用按照國務院規定列支。

sentences.english: Batch production of products should be do random inspection on a regular basis.
sentences.chinese: 成批生產的產品應定期做抽查檢驗。

sentences.english: State cross-licensing series of continuous supervision and checking of the country and be assured of qualified products.
sentences.chinese: 國光牌系列橫機是國家監督抽查連續合格及放心產品。

sentences.english: FIFA reserves the right to execute spot checks atthe associations with regard to the examination procedure.
sentences.chinese: 國際足聯保留抽查各協會考試程序的權利。

definition: to test a random sample/to spot-check
sudden unannounced investigation/on-the-spot inspection/to search without notification
to reconsider/to reexamine/to review (e.g. a report prior to accepting it)
to investigate and handle (a criminal case)
